question: 裁判
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: You're going to get <kanji>judge</kanji>d times two. <kanji>Judge</kanji> and <kanji>judge</kanji> again. Once by the judge and another time by the jury. This is a whole <vocabulary>trial</vocabulary> here.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. You hopefully learned this on'yomi for <ja>判</ja> with the word <ja>評判</ja>, but here's a mnemonic to help you just in case:

After your <reading>ban</reading> (<ja>ばん</ja>) on the WaniKani forums, you now face <vocabulary>trial</vocabulary> before none other than Judge Koichi. He's going to decide whether your ban will be lifted or not. Good luck, there's a lot at stake.
